intro: Asterochlaena hieronymi var. genuina, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub with upright stems and produces vibrant blooms in shades of pink, purple, and white. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Asterochlaena hieronymi var. genuina is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
